headline: Chief Appoints Roshanie Ross as Chief Experience Officer, a Customer-Obsessed Leader Driving Innovation Across the Member Journey
summary: NEW YORK, October 20, 2025--Chief, the most powerful membership community and platform for senior women leaders, has named Roshanie Ross as Chief Experience Officer (CXO). Ross is a dynamic senior leader known for scaling organizations that blend operational excellence with a customer-obsessed user experience. As CXO, Ross will lead the next chapter of innovation as Chief continues to tailor its member experience—creating a seamless journey that spans the many ways members connect across the com

headline: US Financial 15 Split Corp. Preferred Dividend Declared
summary: TORONTO, Oct. 20, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- US Financial 15 Split Corp ("US Financial 15") declares its monthly distribution of $0.07083 for each Preferred share, or 10.00% annually based on the previous month end net asset value. Distributions are payable November 10, 2025 to shareholders on record as at October 31, 2025. US Financial 15 invests in a portfolio consisting of 15 U.S. financial services companies as follows: American Express, Bank of America, Bank of New York Mellon Corp., Citigrou

headline: Digital Payment Today - Surging Growth In US Drives Payment Innovation Forward
summary: The United States digital payment market is projected to undergo significant growth, expanding from USD 3.06 trillion in 2024 to USD 9.29 trillion by 2033, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 13.11%. This upward trajectory is fueled by high smartphone and internet penetration, innovative payment technologies, and shifts in consumer behavior toward convenience and security through digital platforms like mobile wallets and online banking. The COVID-19 pandemic notably accelerated the...

headline: S&P 500 Futures Rise on Renewed Fed Rate Cut Hopes
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Monday, Oct, 20 2025 US stock futures are in positive territory before the opening bell as investors react to a fresh wave of economic signals that reinforce expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts. Hopes for easier monetary policy have been fueled by sliding Treasury yields and subdued manufacturing activity. However, persistent uncertainty around the banking sector and delayed government data is keeping market sentiment cautious while investors...

headline: Heard on the Street Friday Recap: Fine With China
summary: Trump said the U.S. is “going to do fine with China.”  In a television interview, he said the extra 100% charge on goods from China that he has threatened to introduce at the start of November wasn't sustainable. U.S. stock indexes climbed, with the Nasdaq, the Dow, and the S&P 500 each closing up 0.5%.  Jefferies appears to have calmed investors’ worst fears about the bank’s involvement in the collapse of auto-parts maker First Brands.

Jefferies appears to have calmed investors’ worst fears about the bank’s involvement in the collapse of auto-parts maker First Brands.
